doc.ContractDescription: THIS IS A COINVESTIGATOR PROPOSAL FOR A MULTIINSTITUTION INVESTIGATION TO SEARCH FOR FEATURES IN COSMICRAY ELEMENTAL SPECTRA AND/OR ABUNDANCE CHANGES THAT MIGHT BE RELATED TO THE KNEE AROUND 3 X 10^15 EV IN THE ALL PARTICLE SPECTRUM. THE COSMIC RAY ENERGETICS AND MASS CREAM INSTRUMENT IS A QUARTER SCALE VERSION OF THE ACCESS MISSION PRIORITIZED IN THE LAST DECADAL STUDY REPORT ASTRONOMY AND ASTROPHYSICS IN THE NEW MILLENIUM. WE ARE STRIVING TO ACHIEVE THE PRIMARY ACCESS GOAL TO DETERMINE WHETHER AND HOW THE KNEE STRUCTURE IS RELATED TO COSMIC RAY ORIGIN, ACCELERATION, AND PROPAGATION THROUGH A SERIES OF BALLOON FLIGHTS. OUR ONGOING EXPERIMENT HAS ALREADY ACCUMULATED 156 DAYS OF EXPOSURE, MORE THAN ANY OTHER SINGLE BALLOON BORNE INSTRUMENT. ITS EXCELLENT PERFORMANCE THROUGHOUT FIVE SUCCESSFUL ANTARCTICA FLIGHTS CAN BE ATTRIBUTED TO THE FACT THAT THE INSTRUMENT WAS DEVELOPED FOR NOMINAL 100 DAY ULTRA LONG DURATION BALLOON ULDB MISSIONS. MULTIPLE CHARGE MEASUREMENTS USING TIMING, PIXELATED SI, AND CHERENKOV DETECTORS, IN ADDITION TO REDUNDANT, CROSS CALIBRATED ENERGY MEASUREMENTS USING A TRANSITION RADIATION DETECTOR AND AN IONIZATION CALORIMETER, ENSURE PRECISE MEASUREMENTS OF INDIVIDUAL ELEMENTS FROM PROTONS TO FE NUCLEI. THE ONGOING ANALYSIS INDICATES THAT HIGHER STATISTICS ARE CRITICAL FOR INTERPRETATION OF SOME INTERESTING FEATURES ALREADY OBSERVED IN THE DATA, AS DISCUSSED IN THIS PROPOSAL. WE HAVE DEMONSTRATED THAT ANNUAL FLIGHTS ARE PRACTICAL WITH TWO PAYLOADS THAT CAN BE FLOWN IN ALTERNATE YEARS. IT IS REASONABLE TO EXPECT A TOTAL ACCUMULATION OF 300 DAYS EXPOSURE WITH FIVE MORE FLIGHTS OVER THE NEXT FIVE YEARS, EVEN MORE IF ULDB BECOMES AVAILABLE. THE DATA FROM EACH FLIGHT WOULD REDUCE THE STATISTICAL UNCERTAINTIES AND EXTEND THE MEASUREMENT REACH TO ENERGIES HIGHER THAN PREVIOUSLY POSSIBLE. ULTIMATELY, OUR DATA WILL PROVIDE SUBSTANTIAL OVERLAP AND, THEREBY, CALIBRATION FOR GROUND BASED, INDIRECT MEASUREMENTS AT MUCH HIGHER ENERGIES. UNDERSTANDING THE NATURE OF THE COSMIC ACCELERATOR IS RELEVANT FOR THE NASA 2006 STRATEGIC PLAN GOAL 3D TO DISCOVER THE ORIGIN, STRUCTURE, EVOLUTION, AND DESTINY OF THE UNIVERSE.

doc.ProductorServiceCode: F108: ENVIRONMENTAL SYSTEMS PROTECTION- ENVIRONMENTAL REMEDIATION

doc.ContractDescription: USING BOTH ASTER THERMAL INFRARED (TIR) AND VISIBLE-NEAR INFRARED (VNIR), WITH ERS-2 AND ALOS PALSAR MICROWAVE SAR SENSORS (C- AND L-BANDS) THERE IS AN OPPORTUNITY TO FORECAST FUTURE EXPLOSIVE VOLCANIC ACTIVITY IN HIGHLY POPULATED, DEVELOPING COUNTRIES. THE RESEARCH PROPOSED HERE WILL FIRST REFINE MODELS OF SURFACE COMPOSITION AND ROUGHNESS USING PUMICE AND OBSIDIAN SAMPLES FROM MONO DOMES (CALIFORNIA, USA) BEFORE APPLICATION TO EXISTING PYROCLASTIC FLOW AND LAHAR DEPOSITS AT MERAPI VOLCANO (INDONESIA) AND SHIVELUCH VOLCANO (RUSSIA). SHIVELUCH AND MERAPI VOLCANOES HAVE HAD NUMEROUS ERUPTIONS IN THE PAST DECADE THAT HAVE PRODUCED MANY DIVERSE SIZES AND STYLES OF FLOW DEPOSITS. IT IS HYPOTHESIZED THAT SURFACE TEXTURE AND COMPOSITION OF LAHAR AND PDC DEPOSITS CAN BE CHARACTERIZED USING TIR AND SAR DATA TO UNDERSTAND THE ERUPTIONS THAT FORMED THEM. THIS WILL BE ACHIEVED THROUGH QUANTIFYING AND INTEGRATING: 1) DEPOSIT MORPHOLOGY; 2) MICRON- (VESICULARITY) SCALE AND CM- (BLOCK SIZE) ROUGHNESS; AND 3) COMPOSITION. THESE PARAMETERS INDICATE MAGMA COMPOSITION, VOLATILE CONTENT AND FRAGMENTATION CONDITIONS AND THE INTEGRATION OF THESE DATASETS AIMS TO IDENTIFY DEPOSIT TYPE AND ORIGINATING ERUPTIVE STYLE, AND RESULTING HAZARDS TO LOCAL POPULATION AND PROPERTY. THIS DATABASE CAN GIVE INSIGHT TO THE MAGMA SYSTEM EVOLUTION AND FUTURE ERUPTION STYLE TO AID IN DISASTER MANAGEMENT AND DECISION MAKING. COMPOSITIONAL DATA WILL BE DERIVED USING SATELLITE THERMAL INFRARED SPECTRAL DECONVOLUTION METHODS DESCRIBED BY RAMSEY AND CHRISTENSEN (1998). MICRON-SCALE SURFACE ROUGHNESS WILL BE QUANTIFIED BY IMPROVING THE VESICULARITY MODEL DEVELOPED BY RAMSEY AND FINK (1999) USING A TWO-COMPONENT SPECTRAL DECONVOLUTION MODEL APPLIED TO TIR WAVELENGTHS AND COMPARED TO SEMDERIVED ROUGHNESS VALUES. THESE RESULTS WILL BE EXTENDED TO SURFACE MORPHOLOGY DERIVED FROM OPTICAL WAVELENGTHS, AND BLOCK SIZE MEASUREMENTS DERIVED FROM SAR DATA OF THE SAME FLOWS AND SUBSEQUENTLY CORRELATED TO PREVIOUS GROUND- AND LAB- BASED STUDIES OF THESE DEPOSITS. THE DATA PRODUCED BY THIS RESEARCH WILL BE CORRELATED TO PAST VOLCANIC ACTIVITY, AND THEN COMBINED WITH TOPOGRAPHICAL DATA FOR VOLCANIC HAZARD APPLICATION TO ASSESS RISK TO LOCAL POPULATIONS. THIS RESEARCH AIMS TO IMPROVE REMOTE SENSING MODELING OF EXPLOSIVE ERUPTIONS THROUGH STUDIES IN AREAS DIFFICULT TO ACCESS AND MONITOR, INCLUDING HUMID, CLOUD-COVERED ENVIRONMENTS THAT ARE A CHALLENGE TO REMOTE SENSING, WHICH ARE AREAS THAT COMMONLY HAVE INCREASED POPULATIONS IN HARM'S WAY.
doc.MajorAgency: NASA EARTH AND SPACE SCIENCE FELLOWSHIP 2014
doc.MajorFundingAgency: NASA EARTH AND SPACE SCIENCE FELLOWSHIP 2014

doc.ContractDescription: SAGLOBAL ATMOSPHERIC MIXING RATIOS OF CARBON DIOXIDE (CO2) HAVE INCREASED BY 36% IN THE LAST 250 YEARS, WITH HALF OF THIS RISE OCCURRING IN THE LAST FOUR DECADES. THE AVERAGE RATE OF INCREASE DURING THIS TIME HAS BEEN APPROXIMATELY 1.4 PARTS PER MILLION (PPM) PER YEAR. BECAUSE THE NORTH AMERICAN TERRESTRIAL BIOSPHERE ACTS AS A SINK FOR ATMOSPHERIC CO2, IT IS IMPORTANT TO DETERMINE ITS SPATIAL DISTRIBUTION AND QUANTIFY ITS MAGNITUDE. TERRESTRIAL SOURCES AND SINKS MAY BE ESTIMATED USING THE ATMOSPHERIC INVERSE METHOD WHEREIN ATMOSPHERIC TRANSPORT MODELS USE PRIOR CARBON FLUXES AND THEN ADJUST THEM TO BE CONSISTENT WITH OBSERVATIONS. RUNNING REANALYZED METEOROLOGY BACKWARDS IN TIME EFFECTIVELY RELATES ATMOSPHERIC CONCENTRATIONS OF CO2 TO SURFACE FLUXES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO THE DETECTED CONCENTRATIONS. THIS PROJECT AIMS TO APPLY THE INVERSION METHOD TO DEVELOP AN ATMOSPHERIC INVERSE FLUX ESTIMATE OF TERRESTRIAL CARBON FLUXES THROUGHOUT THE INTEGRATED COLUMN OVER NORTH AMERICA FROM 2008-2014. THIS CONTINENTAL-SCALE INVERSION WILL BE NOVEL AND IMPORTANT FOR SEVERAL REASONS. FIRST, IT WILL INCORPORATE THE EXTENSIVE ADDITIONS TO THE OBSERVATIONAL TOWER NETWORK OVER THE CONTINENT DURING THE LAST DECADE. GREATER SPATIAL DATA DENSITY ALLOWS FOR MORE ACCURATE INVERSION CARBON FLUX ESTIMATES. SECOND, IT WILL USE THE MESOSCALE WEATHER AND RESEARCH FORECASTING (WRF) MODEL AT 30 X 30 KM GRID SPACING, ALLOWING FOR MUCH FINER SIMULATION OF ATMOSPHERIC DYNAMICS OVER THE DOMAIN THAN THE GLOBAL MODELS USED IN MANY PREVIOUS STUDIES. THIS RESOLUTION FACILITATES MORE ACCURATE REPRESENTATION OF SYNOPTIC EVENTS AND THEIR INFLUENCE ON ATMOSPHERIC CO2 TRANSPORT, SUCH AS BETTER REPRESENTATION OF VERTICAL MIXING. THIRD, THE MODEL SCHEME IS FLEXIBLE TO VARIED BOUNDARY CONDITIONS, TRANSPORT REPRESENTATIONS, AND SURFACE FLUX PRIOR INPUTS. I WILL EXAMINE HOW INVERSE ESTIMATES OF INTEGRATED COLUMN CO2 OVER NORTH AMERICA CHANGES WITH EACH OF THESE COMPONENTS TO DEVELOP A RANGE OF POTENTIAL ESTIMATE UNCERTAINTY. MY FIRST OBJECTIVE IS TO EXAMINE HOW WELL THE MODEL CAPTURES INTERANNUAL VARIATION IN CLIMATE CONDITIONS AND CARBON FLUXES CAUSED BY THESE CLIMATE VARIATIONS AND THEIR IMPACT ON THE NORTH AMERICAN TERRESTRIAL BIOSPHERE. SUCH VARIATION INCLUDES SHIFTS IN THE START AND END DATES OF THE GROWING SEASON, AS WELL AS ITS DURATION. FLOODS AND DROUGHTS ARE REPRESENTED IN THIS TIME FRAME AND MODEL SIMULATION OF THE RESULTING CARBON FLUXES WILL BE EVALUATED INTERANNUALLY AND ON THE CONTINENTAL SCALE FOR THE FIRST TIME. THE ORBITING CARBON OBSERVATORY (OCO)-2, SCHEDULED FOR LAUNCH THIS JULY, WILL MAKE GLOBAL MEASUREMENTS OF CO2, PROVIDING ATMOSPHERIC CO2 DRY AIR COLUMN MOLE FRACTIONS. THESE DATA WILL REQUIRE EVALUATION AND AS SUCH, MY SECOND OBJECTIVE IS TO COMPARE THESE PRECISE MEASUREMENTS TO MY INVERSION RESULTS TO EVALUATE SPATIAL, TEMPORAL, AND VERTICAL DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THEM.
doc.MajorAgency: MULTIYEAR ATMOSPHERIC INVERSION FOR NORTH AMERICAN

doc.ContractDescription: X-RAY ASTRONOMY EXCELS AT OBSERVING SOME OF THE MOST ENERGETIC OBJECTS IN THE UNIVERSE, SUCH AS SUPERNOVAE AND BLACK HOLE ACCRETION DISKS. THESE IMMENSE ENERGIES HAVE ADVERSE EFFECTS ON THE SURROUNDING UNIVERSE. SUPERNOVAE INTRODUCE PRESSURE WAVES THAT ARE NEEDED TO FORM THE NEXT GENERATION OF STARS IN MOLECULAR CLOUDS, WHILE ACCRETION DISKS GIVE RISE TO POWERFUL JETS THAT ALLOW OBSERVATIONS OF THE UNIVERSE AS IT EXISTED BILLIONS OF YEARS AGO. BECAUSE THE EARTH S ATMOSPHERE IS VERY EFFECTIVE AT SHIELDING US FROM COSMIC X-RAYS, IT IS NECESSARY TO DO OUR OBSERVING FROM ORBIT. BY USING CHARGE COUPLED DEVICES (CCDS), CURRENT X-RAY SPACE TELESCOPES HAVE PROVIDED INSIGHTS INTO THE UNIVERSE, AND HAVE OPENED THE DOORS FOR THE NEXT-GENERATION OF X-RAY SATELLITES. THESE FUTURE MISSIONS WILL HAVE A GREATER THROUGHPUT OF INCOMING PHOTONS; SURPASSING THE CAPABILITIES OF THE FASTEST CCDS. THESE MISSIONS WILL BE OBSERVING GAMMA RAY BURSTS TO GLEAN INFORMATION ABOUT LARGESCALE STRUCTURE OF SPACE, AND STUDYING THE ENVIRONMENT AROUND BLAZARS AND SUPERMASSIVE BLACK HOLES, AMONG OTHER THINGS. CURRENT XRAY MISSIONS SUFFER FROM PHOTON PILEUP WHEN OBSERVING MODERATELY BRIGHT SOURCES, RESULTING IN A LOSS OF ENERGY AND FLUX INFORMATION. THIS DEMONSTRATES A NEED FOR MORE ADVANCED HARDWARE IN ORDER INVESTIGATE THE UNIVERSE AROUND US. THE REPLACEMENT FOR CCDS ON FUTURE MISSIONS WILL COME IN THE FORM OF HYBRID CMOS DETECTORS (HCDS). HCDS OFFER MANY BENEFITS OVER CCDS, AND ARE ALREADY UTILIZED IN INFRARED AND OPTICAL ASTRONOMY. THEIR FOREMOST ADVANTAGE IS THEIR ABILITY TO READ INDIVIDUAL PIXELS OUT AS OPPOSED TO THE BUCKET-BRIGADE STYLE ASSOCIATED WITH CCDS. THIS ALLOWS FOR LOW NOISE LEVELS WHILE MAINTAINING A SIGNIFICANTLY FASTER READOUT RATE THAT AVOIDS PILEUP ISSUES FROM HIGH-INTENSITY SOURCES. BECAUSE OF THIS NOVEL READOUT STYLE, HCDS ARE MUCH MORE RADIATION HARD THAN CCDS; RESULTING IN A LONGER USEFUL LIFETIME. LASTLY, HCDS ARE MORE ENERGY EFFICIENT AND REQUIRE AN ORDER OF MAGNITUDE LESS POWER THAN CURRENT COUNTERPARTS. A NEW HYBRID CMOS DETECTOR CALLED THE SPEEDSTER-EXD, PRODUCED BY THE X-RAY INSTRUMENTATION LAB AT PENN STATE, HAS BEEN PROVEN TO OFFER ALL OF THESE BENEFITS. IT IS A 64X64 PIXEL DETECTOR THAT WAS DONE AS A PROOF-OF-CONCEPT TO SHOW THAT SUCH TECHNOLOGY IS A REALISTIC OPTION IN X-RAY ASTRONOMY, AND HAS MADE CLEAR THE TECHNIQUES THAT WILL BE EMPLOYED AS WE MOVE CLOSER TO A SPACE-READY SETUP. THE NEXT STEP IN THE DEVELOPMENT PROCESS IS TO MOVE TO A LARGER FORMAT ARRAY THAT WILL BE AN EQUIVALENT TO WHAT ONE MIGHT EXPECT TO FIND ON A NEXT-GENERATION X-RAY TELESCOPE. WE ARE CURRENTLY DESIGNING AND BUILDING A COMPARABLE 550X550 PIXEL DETECTOR USING THE SCALED UP TECHNIQUES LEARNED FROM THE PROTOTYPE. MY RESEARCH WILL FOCUS ON CALIBRATING AND CHARACTERIZING ITS PERFORMANCE. ALONG WITH USING STANDARD TECHNIQUES TO MODEL NOISE LEVELS AND GAIN VARIATIONS, I WILL PERFORM NEW AND RIGOROUS TESTS TO DESCRIBE THE ENERGY RESOLUTION, QUANTUM EFFICIENCY, AND EFFECTS OF PROTON DAMAGE. THESE TESTS SPAN AN ENERGY RANGE OF 0.5 TO 14 KEV THROUGH CONTROLLED EXPOSURES TO A VARIETY OF X-RAY SOURCES. I WILL CALCULATE THE QUANTUM EFFICIENCY BY DESIGNING AND BUILDING A UNIQUE TEST STAND THAT IS COMPATIBLE WITH THE NEW DETECTOR. BY UTILIZING A WELL-CHARACTERIZED PROPORTIONAL COUNTER, I WILL ACCURATELY DETERMINE THE LIMITS OF DETECTION FOR THIS NEW DETECTOR. IT IS ALSO IMPERATIVE TO DEFINE HOW SUCH DETECTORS WILL FARE IN THE HIGH-ENERGY PROTON WINDS FOUND IN OUTER SPACE. BECAUSE CHARGE IS TRANSFERRED THROUGH SEVERAL CENTIMETERS OF MATERIAL IN A CCD, CHARGE-TRANSFER ABILITIES ARE HINDERED BY PROTON DAMAGE. THIS REDUCES IMAGE QUALITY DUE TO DEGRADATION IN THE ENERGY RESOLUTION. ON AN HCD THE CHARGE IS TRANSFERRED THROUGH A FEW HUNDRED MICRONS, SO TRAUMA IS RESTRICTED TO THE LOCAL AREA. THE USE OF THE RELATIVISTIC HEAVY ION COLLIDER AT BROOKHAVEN NATIONAL LABS WILL ALLOW ME TO GATHER VITAL DATA ON HOW THESE DETECTORS WILL BEHAVE ONCE IN ORBIT.
doc.MajorAgency: TESTING AND CHARACTERIZATION OF A NEXT-GENERATION
doc.MajorFundingAgency: TESTING AND CHARACTERIZATION OF A NEXT-GENERATION

doc.ProductorServiceCode: N046: INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT- WATER PURIFICATION AND SEWAGE TREATMENT EQUIPMENT

doc.ContractDescription: NASA S TESS MISSION IS EXPECTED TO FIND THOUSANDS OF PLANETS SMALLER THAN NEPTUNE, AND DOZENS OF PLANETS THAT ARE COMPARABLE IN SIZE TO THE EARTH. HOWEVER, THE TESS FOLLOW-UP PROGRAM IS STARVED FOR SUFFICIENTLY HIGH-PRECISION GROUND-BASED FOLLOW-UP RESOURCES TO CONFIRM AND CHARACTERIZE THE SLEW OF PLANET CANDIDATES. I PROPOSE TO DEPLOY INSTRUMENTATION CAPABLE OF HITHERTO UNAVAILABLE HIGH PRECISION PHOTOMETRY AND SPECTROSCOPY FROM THE GROUND. THIS CAPABILITY WILL FACILITATE RAPID FOLLOW-UP OF TESS PLANET CANDIDATES, ALLOWING THE COMMUNITY TO FOCUS ON THE HIGHEST PRIORITY CANDIDATE PLANETS THE TERRESTRIAL WORLDS ON THE SHORTLIST FOR CAREFUL ATMOSPHERIC CHARACTERIZATION WITH JWST. I PROPOSE TO: A) DEPLOY AN ENGINEERED DIFFUSER AT THE ASTROPHYSICAL RESEARCH COUNCIL TELESCOPE IMAGING CAMERA (ARCTIC) AT THE ARC 3.5M TELESCOPE, TO ENABLE SPACE-QUALITY PHOTOMETRY (~100PPM) OF BRIGHT STARS FROM THE GROUND; B) CONTINUE MY RESEARCH ON THE ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL SYSTEM (ECS) OF THE HABITABLE ZONE PLANET FINDER (HPF), AN ULTRA-STABILIZED SPECTROGRAPH CAPABLE OF 1M/S PRECISION IN THE NIR, TO BE DEPLOYED AT THE 10M CLASS HOBBY-EBERLY TELESCOPE (HET) TO LOOK FOR ROCKY PLANETS IN THE HABITABLE ZONES OF NEARBY M-DWARFS. ADDITIONALLY, I AM A PART OF A TEAM IN THE DEVELOPMENT PHASE FOR THE NASA/NSF EXTREME PRECISION DOPPLER SPECTROGRAPH (EPDS), THE NEXT GENERATION SPECTROGRAPH FOR THE WIYN TELESCOPE AT KITT PEAK. THE PROJECT IS ADVANCING ON BOTH FRONTS: A) I HAVE ALREADY TESTED AN ENGINEERED DIFFUSER FROM RPC PHOTONICS IN THE LAB: THE DIFFUSER IS CAPABLE OF HOMOGENIZING AND SHAPING THE INPUT BEAM, IMAGING A SMALL POINT SOURCE INTO A CLEAN AND STABLE TOP-HAT SHAPE DISTRIBUTED OVER MANY PIXELS. OVER THE NEXT FEW MONTHS I WILL WORK WITH VENDORS AND COLLABORATORS AT THE ARC TO PROCURE AN OPTIMIZED DIFFUSER FOR DEPLOYMENT AT ARCTIC IN LATE 2016. B) WE HAVE ALREADY DEMONSTRATED SUB-MK TEMPERATURE STABILITY OF THE HPF ECS OVER MORE THAN TWO WEEKS, AND PRESSURE STABILITY OF<10^-7 TORR OVER MONTHS, FAR EXCEEDING THE ENVIRONMENTAL STABILITY REQUIREMENTS REQUIRED FOR BOTH HPF AND EPDS AN EXCITING MILESTONE FOR PRECISE ENVIRONMENTAL STABILIZATION OF ASTRONOMICAL INSTRUMENTS. WE WILL COMMISSION HPF ON-SKY IN EARLY 2017. THIS PROJECT DIRECTLY SUPPORTS PAST (KEPLER), PRESENT (K2), AND FUTURE (TESS, JWST) NASA ASTROPHYSICS MISSIONS THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF NEW GROUND-BASED INSTRUMENTATION CAPABLE OF HIGH-PRECISION PHOTOMETRY AND SPECTROSCOPY. IMPROVEMENTS ON BOTH FRONTS WILL ENABLE MORE DETECTIONS OF ROCKY PLANETS IN THE HABITABLE ZONES OF THEIR HOST STARS, ADVANCING ONE OF NASA S SCIENCE PLAN OBJECTIVES OF SEARCHING FOR LIFE ON PLANETS AROUND OTHER STARS .
doc.MajorAgency: EXTREME PRECISION PHOTOMETRY AND RADIAL VELOCIMETR
doc.MajorFundingAgency: EXTREME PRECISION PHOTOMETRY AND RADIAL VELOCIMETR

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::CT::IGF - SECURE ON-SITE SHREDDING SERVICES OY3

IGF::OT::IGF THE CONTRACTOR SHALL SUPPLY PROFESSIONAL SUPPORT SERVICES WITH REGARD TO THE INTEGRATION, DEVELOPMENT, MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT OF INTEGRATED LOGISTICS PRODUCTS AND PROCESSES FOR SURFACE FLEET, CARRIER AND SUBMARINE PLATFORMS

THE GOALS OF THIS RESEARCH ADDRESS TWO OF THE FOCUS AREAS IN NASA S EARTH SCIENCE RESEARCH PROGRAM: EARTH SURFACE AND INTERIOR AND DISASTERS. IN THIS RESEARCH, WE WILL UTILIZE SPACE-BASED OBSERVATIONS OF CRUSTAL DEFORMATION (GPS AND INSAR) AT SUBDUCTION ZONES IN CONJUNCTION WITH CO-SEISMIC SEISMOLOGICAL DATA AND NUMERICAL MODELING TO PROVIDE IMPROVED ESTIMATES OF THE CHARACTERISTICS OF GREAT (MOMENT MAGNITUDE MW 8.0 AND LARGER) MEGATHRUST EARTHQUAKES. THIS STUDY WILL ADDRESS THE QUESTION OF WHAT ROLE RHEOLOGICAL STRUCTURE AND HETEROGENEITY WITHIN THE UPPER PLATE OF THE SUBDUCTION SYSTEM PLAY IN THE ACCUMULATION AND RELEASE OF STRAIN OVER THE EARTHQUAKE CYCLE. WE WILL USE THE DENSE AND HIGH QUALITY GEODETIC AND SEISMOLOGICAL OBSERVATIONS RELATED TO THE 2011 MW 9.0 TOHOKU, JAPAN EARTHQUAKE TO IDENTIFY THE EFFECTS OF RHEOLOGICAL AND MECHANICAL STRUCTURE ON THE PATTERNS OF STRAIN ACCUMULATION AND RELEASE. BY COMBINING THESE DATASETS WITH FINITE ELEMENT MODELING CODES, WE WILL BE ABLE TO DEVELOP REALISTIC, THREE-DIMENSIONAL MODELS FOR THE DISTRIBUTION OF STRAIN ACCUMULATION INTER-SEISMICALLY, ALLOWING IMPROVED ESTIMATES OF THE COUPLING PATTERNS ON THE PLATE INTERFACE AND HOW THIS STRAIN RELATES TO THE SUBSEQUENT MEGATHRUST EARTHQUAKE. THESE RESULTS WILL ALLOW US TO ASSESS THE POTENTIAL CHARACTERISTICS OF MEGATHRUST EARTHQUAKES GLOBALLY.
doc.MajorAgency: NASA EARTH AND SPACE SCIENCE FELLOWSHIP 2014
doc.MajorFundingAgency: NASA EARTH AND SPACE SCIENCE FELLOWSHIP 2014

doc.ProductorServiceCode: J020: MAINT/REPAIR/REBUILD OF EQUIPMENT- SHIP AND MARINE EQUIPMENT

doc.ContractDescription: METHANE IS THE SECOND MOST POWERFUL GREENHOUSE GAS (GHG) AFTER CARBON DIOXIDE. THE CONCENTRATION OF METHANE HAS BEEN INCREASED FROM 700 PPB IN PRE-INDUSTRIAL TIMES TO 1758-1874 PPB IN RECENT YEARS. ONE MAJOR ANTHROPOGENIC METHANE SOURCE IS THE NATURAL GAS AND OIL DEVELOPMENT, WHICH CONTRIBUTES TO 23% OF THE TOTAL ANTHROPOGENIC METHANE EMISSION IN 2012. EXTRACTIONS OF NATURAL GAS FROM UNCONVENTIONAL SOURCES, ESPECIALLY SHALE GAS, ARE A RAPIDLY GROWING DOMESTIC ENERGY SOURCE IN RECENT YEARS. HOWEVER, RECENT WORK SHOWED THAT METHANE EMISSIONS FROM NATURAL GAS AND OIL PRODUCTION ARE UNDERESTIMATED BY THE CURRENT EMISSION INVENTORY. THUS, DEVELOPING MORE RELIABLE DATASETS ON METHANE EMISSIONS FROM SHALE GAS DEVELOPMENT IS OF GREAT SIGNIFICANCE TO UNDERSTAND THE GAP OF CURRENT ESTIMATION AND HOW THE RAPID INCREASE OF SHALE GAS EXTRACTIONS ALTER THE METHANE LEVELS IN THE ATMOSPHERE. THE PI OF THIS PROJECT, PROF. ALBERT PRESTO, IS CURRENTLY LEADING A DOE-NETL FUNDED PROJECT TO MEASURE METHANE EMISSIONS FROM NATURAL GAS PRODUCTIONS IN THE MARCELLUS SHALE REGION, WHICH IS ONE MAJOR SHALE GAS FORMATION IN U.S. THE TEAM HAS ALREADY MEASURED OVER 30 FACILITIES. HOWEVER, SINCE METHANE EMISSIONS ARE HIGHLY VARIABLE FOR DIFFERENT FACILITIES, HOW WELL THESE SAMPLED FACILITIES REFLECT THE OVERALL METHANE EMISSIONS FROM SHALE GAS DEVELOPMENT REMAIN UNCERTAIN. HERE WE PROPOSE TO COMPLEMENT THIS BOTTOM-UP MEASUREMENT WITH THE TOP-DOWN INVERSE MODELING TO INFER METHANE EMISSIONS. THE RETRIEVED METHANE ABUNDANCE FROM SATELLITE DATA INCLUDING SCIAMACHY (2008-2012), GOSAT (2008-2014) AND TES (2008-2014)WILL FIRST BE VALIDATED WITH IN SITU MEASUREMENTS FROM NOAA S CARBONTRACKER SYSTEM (2008-2014) AND NASA S DISCOVER-AQ AIRCRAFT CAMPAIGN (2011-2013). THEN THE SATELLITE AND IN SITU METHANE MEASUREMENTS WILL BE COMBINED TO CONSTRAIN METHANE EMISSIONS WITH THE BAYESIAN INVERSION, WHICH WILL BE CONDUCTED WITH GEOS-CHEM ON THE NORTH AMERICAN SUBDOMAIN WITH A SPECIFIC FOCUS ON MARCELLUS REGION FROM 2008 TO 2014. A PREDETERMINED A PRIORI EMISSION FIELD WILL BE IMPLEMENTED INTO GEOS-CHEM AND BE ITERATIVELY SCALED UNTIL THE MODELED METHANE CONCENTRATIONS MATCH THE REMOTE SENSING AND IN SITU OBSERVATIONS. FINALLY, WE WILL CHECK WHETHER THE BOTTOM-UP AND THE TOP-DOWN ESTIMATIONS AGREE WITH EACH OTHER WITHIN ACCEPTABLE UNCERTAINTIES. TO OUR KNOWLEDGE, CURRENTLY THERE ARE VERY FEW METHANE INVERSE MODELING WORKS FOCUSING ON MARCELLUS REGION WITH A TIME PERIOD AFTER 2010. ALSO, VERY FEW WORKS CONDUCTED METHANE INVERSE MODELING WITH MULTI-YEAR SATELLITE DATA SETS; MULTI-YEAR SATELLITE DATA SETS COULD REVEAL HOW THE GROWTH OF SHALE GAS DEVELOPMENT ENHANCED THE REGIONAL ATMOSPHERIC METHANE ABUNDANCE AND PROVIDE VALUABLE INFORMATION ON INVERSE MODELING. THE COMBINATION OF THE TOP-DOWN AND BOTTOM-UP MAKES OUR RESULTS MORE RELIABLE COMPARED WITH WORKS THAT ONLY USE ONE METHOD. THE UNCERTAINTIES OF THE BOTTOM-UP INVENTORIES CAN BE NARROWED DOWN BY THE TOP-DOWN ESTIMATION; AND THE SOURCE APPORTIONMENT BASED ON BOTTOM-UP MEASUREMENTS CAN BE USED TO VERIFY THE SOURCE ATTRIBUTION OF THE TOP-DOWN MODELING. THE PROPOSED WORK WILL PROVIDE A BETTER ESTIMATION OF THE METHANE EMISSION RATES FROM SHALE GAS DEVELOPMENT IN MARCELLUS SHALE REGION, WHICH WILL ALSO PROVIDE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING ON THE CHANGE OF THE METHANE BURDEN IN THE ATMOSPHERE. THIS IS ALIGNED WELL WITH THE NASA S GOAL OF UNDERSTANDING THE CHANGING OF ATMOSPHERIC COMPOSITION. ON THE POLICY PERSPECTIVE, SINCE NATURAL GAS HAS BEEN CONSIDERED AS BRIDGE FUEL BECAUSE IT EMITS LESS CO2 THAN OTHER FOSSIL FUELS DURING COMBUSTION, YET TOO MUCH METHANE EMISSIONS MAY OFFSET THIS BENEFIT, A BETTER ESTIMATION OF MARCELLUS SHALE METHANE EMISSIONS IS ALSO IMPORTANT TO JUSTIFY THE DEVELOPMENT OF SHALE GAS. MOREOVER, THE PROPOSED WORK WILL VALIDATE NASA S SATELLITE DATA (TES) AND WILL ALSO USE DATA FROM NASA S SATELLITE (TES) AND NASA S FILED CAMPAIGN (DISCOVER-AQ) TO IDENTIFY LOCAL METHANE SOURCES
doc.MajorAgency: CONSTRAINING MARCELLUS SHALE METHANE EMISSIONS WIT
doc.MajorFundingAgency: CONSTRAINING MARCELLUS SHALE METHANE EMISSIONS WIT

doc.ContractDescription: THE PROPOSED GRADUATE RESEARCH ATTEMPTS TO ADDRESS MULTIPLE QUESTIONS OF THE NASA SCIENCE MISSION DIRECTORATE SMD. ONE OF THE OVERALL GOALS OF THE NASA SMD IS TO ADVANCE KNOWLEDGE OF EARTH AS A SYSTEM TO IMPROVE LIFE ON OUR PLANET. THIS WORK WOULD COMBINE DATA FROM MULTIPLE SATELLITE SENSORS AS WELL AS IMAGE BASED DATASETS OF SHORT AND LONG TERM MEASUREMENTS TO STUDY ACTIVE VOLCANIC PROCESSES TO UNDERSTAND THESE PHENOMENA AND PROTECT LIVES AND PROPERTY. THE PRIMARY OVERARCHING GOAL OF THIS PROPOSAL IS THE NASA EARTH SCIENCE FOCUS AREA GOAL CHARACTERIZE THE DYNAMICS OF EARTH S SURFACE AND INTERIOR, IMPROVING THE CAPABILITY TO ASSESS AND RESPOND TO NATURAL HAZARDS AND EXTREME EVENTS. THE FUNDAMENTAL HYPOTHESIS OF THIS PROPOSAL IS, CAN PROXIMAL AND OPTICALLY THICK VOLCANIC PLUMES BE TREATED AS AN EMITTING SURFACE AND THEREFORE TO WHAT ACCURACY CAN TIR DATA BE USED TO DERIVE COMPOSITION, PARTICLE SIZE, AND LONGWAVE LW RADIATIVE FORCING? VOLCANIC PLUMES ARE A COMPLEX MIXTURE OF GAS AND SOLID PARTICLES OF MINERAL FRAGMENTS AND VOLCANIC GLASSES OF VARYING SIZES. BY EXAMINING THESE PRODUCTS, WE CAN GAIN A MUCH GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF THE DYNAMICS OF ERUPTION PLUMES AND THE UNDERLYING PROCESSES THAT GENERATE THEM. THIS ANALYSIS WILL THEREFORE ADDRESS ONE OF THE MAIN QUESTIONS OF THE EARTH SURFACE AND INTERIOR ESI SCIENCE FOCUS AREA, HOW DO MAGMATIC SYSTEMS EVOLVE AND UNDER WHAT CONDITIONS DO VOLCANOES ERUPT? FURTHERMORE, ONCE PLUMES HAVE BEEN GENERATED, THEY CAN MOVE GREAT DISTANCES AND HAVE SOME EFFECT ON BOTH REGIONAL AND GLOBAL CLIMATE. THE SHORT TERM AND LOCAL EFFECTS ON LW RADIATIVE FORCING OF THESE SPECIES ARE NOT FULLY UNDERSTOOD, PARTICULARLY IN THE CASE OF VOLCANIC ASH. THE RESULTS OF THIS WORK WILL THEREFORE PROVIDE INSIGHT INTO THE ATMOSPHERIC COMPOSITION FOCUS AREA MISSION STATEMENT TO ADVANCE THE UNDERSTANDING OF CHANGES IN THE EARTH S RADIATION BALANCE, AIR QUALITY THAT RESULT FROM CHANGES IN ATMOSPHERIC COMPOSITION, BY EXAMINING THE COMPLEX ROLES OF TRANSMISSION, ABSORPTION, AND EMISSION BY THESE CLOUDS. THIS IN TURN PROVIDES A CROSSOVER TO THE CLIMATE VARIABILITY AND CHANGE GOAL, TO IMPROVE THE ABILITY TO PREDICT CLIMATE CHANGES BY BETTER UNDERSTANDING THE ROLES AND INTERACTIONS OF THE ATMOSPHERE, LAND IN THE CLIMATE SYSTEM. THE WORK WILL USE SPECTRAL DATA DERIVED FROM A NEWLYDEVELOPED ASH FLOW CHAMBER IN THE LABORATORY AS WELL AS FROM THE ADVANCED SPACEBORNE THERMAL EMISSION AND REFLECTION RADIOMETER ASTER SENSOR AND ITS URGENT REQUEST PROTOCOL URP ARCHIVE, WHICH HAS BEEN DEVELOPED FOR DETECTING AND MITIGATING VOLCANIC HAZARDS. IN ADDITION TO ASTER, THIS WORK IS ADAPTABLE TO ALLOW OTHER EOS INSTRUMENTS ON THE TERRA, AQUA AND AURA E.G. MODIS, AIRS, ETC SATELLITES TO BE USED TO GAIN A BETTER UNDERSTAND OF THE ERUPTIVE COMPOSITION, VOLCANIC CHANGES TO THE ATMOSPHERE, AND HAZARDS POSED BY VOLCANIC ASH CLOUDS.
